componenttext: We tend to focus a lot on what we're doing, and we do see some competition on the land front. It's constant out there, and it's market-by-market, and it varies. What others are going to do with their entry level entrance, I've heard of others coming to market. There's some of it out there. But broadly, we're not seeing widespread, heavy competition today with us flag-by-flag. Certainly, in our pockets, there's more competition. But generally, we're not seeing it. How others tend to approach that market, that will be up to them. We're focused on providing a great value for the homebuyer. And so our customer can be in their house. They can be in there at a good price they can afford and a place for their family.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: But as entry level grows, we do expect more competition to come, and we're certainly prepared to deal with that as it comes.
componenttext: But as entry level grows, we do expect more competition to come, and we're certainly prepared to deal with that as it comes.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question today is coming from Jade Rahmani from KBW.
componenttext: Our next question today is coming from Jade Rahmani from KBW.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Just wanted to ask regarding leverage at this point in the cycle, is there a plan to retire near-term debt maturities as was indicated in the press release to reduce leverage? Or do you plan to eventually replace those maturities with similar-sized debt o
componenttext: Just wanted to ask regarding leverage at this point in the cycle, is there a plan to retire near-term debt maturities as was indicated in the press release to reduce leverage? Or do you plan to eventually replace those maturities with similar-sized debt offerings?

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: We'll always look at the debt markets, and we'll remain opportunistic there. There are certainly -- it's a favorable market right now, but where we sit today with our cash position, with our expectation for cash flows, we, right now, do not expect to be i
componenttext: We'll always look at the debt markets, and we'll remain opportunistic there. There are certainly -- it's a favorable market right now, but where we sit today with our cash position, with our expectation for cash flows, we, right now, do not expect to be in the debt market in the short term. We have already paid off the $373 million that came due on April 15. We paid that out of cash. And we believe our cash position, our liquidity available on our revolver and our cash flows are sufficient for the remainder of the year, as we sit here today.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: And just regarding other income, can you comment on what drove the spike in the second quarter?
componenttext: And just regarding other income, can you comment on what drove the spike in the second quarter?

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, we did have -- we sold an investment that we had in debt securities. It's been -- you can look back in our 10-Qs. There's been a disclosure around that investment. We had some debt securities that we had acquired a while back that gave us access to s
componenttext: Yes, we did have -- we sold an investment that we had in debt securities. It's been -- you can look back in our 10-Qs. There's been a disclosure around that investment. We had some debt securities that we had acquired a while back that gave us access to some land, that we have now acquired the land and are actively developing it. And we were able to restructure those debt securities and resell them in the market. And so we had a gain on that sale of $4.5 million, which was an improvement in our other income line this quarter.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: And just lastly, the capital market's uncertainty and spread widening that we've seen this year, you may have alluded to it on the land side, the second look you referred to. But have you noticed any impact on either the land market or sales trends due to
componenttext: And just lastly, the capital market's uncertainty and spread widening that we've seen this year, you may have alluded to it on the land side, the second look you referred to. But have you noticed any impact on either the land market or sales trends due to the volatility?

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Hard to attribute it to any one factor. It's just a competitive environment. Deal by deal is different. We are seeing a few more second looks, so that's been very positive for us.
componenttext: Hard to attribute it to any one factor. It's just a competitive environment. Deal by deal is different. We are seeing a few more second looks, so that's been very positive for us.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question today is coming from Jay McCanless from Sterne Agee.
componenttext: Our next question today is coming from Jay McCanless from Sterne Agee.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: First question, I know Houston's a smaller market for you guys, but if you could update us on what's happening on the ground there and what you think you're going to see in terms of delays for either labor and materials to get homes finished.
componenttext: First question, I know Houston's a smaller market for you guys, but if you could update us on what's happening on the ground there and what you think you're going to see in terms of delays for either labor and materials to get homes finished.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Jay, it's business as usual. We're -- we feel for the people and what they're going through in Houston right now with the horrendous flooding. But our operations are fine, and we don't expect any noticeable impact on our business in Houston. Clearly, the
componenttext: Jay, it's business as usual. We're -- we feel for the people and what they're going through in Houston right now with the horrendous flooding. But our operations are fine, and we don't expect any noticeable impact on our business in Houston. Clearly, the market has just softened due to the lower oil prices, but we continue to see very consistent, steady demand at price points below $300,000.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: We like the Houston market, big believers in it long-term. And if it becomes -- if we see an opportunity to buy something at a very advantageous price, we're going to be all over it.
componenttext: We like the Houston market, big believers in it long-term. And if it becomes -- if we see an opportunity to buy something at a very advantageous price, we're going to be all over it.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got it. The second question I had, there was a small order decline in the east geography this quarter. Could you talk about what's going on in that market?
componenttext: Got it. The second question I had, there was a small order decline in the east geography this quarter. Could you talk about what's going on in that market?

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, the east for us is the Carolinas and north, so it's really more northeast for us. And yes, we were down, I believe, 2% in sales units. Our community count in that region was actually down. So our absorptions were actually up mid-single-digit there. S
componenttext: Yes, the east for us is the Carolinas and north, so it's really more northeast for us. And yes, we were down, I believe, 2% in sales units. Our community count in that region was actually down. So our absorptions were actually up mid-single-digit there. So really just reflects probably fewer investments over the last few years manifesting itself in fewer [ph] communities.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016
componenttextpreview: We're kind of going to a reset up in the northeast. We like where we're headed. But it's not going to be a stellar performance this year.
componenttext: We're kind of going to a reset up in the northeast. We like where we're headed. But it's not going to be a stellar performance this year.

headline: DR Horton Inc., Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 21, 2016

componenttext: We have reached the end of our question-and-answer session. I'd like to turn the floor back over to management for any further or closing comments.

componenttext: Thank you, Kevin. We appreciate everyone's time on the call today and look forward to speaking with you again in July to share our third quarter. And I'd also like to once again thank the entire D.R. Horton team. You are truly the best in the industry and your quarter-to-quarter consistent performance proves that out. Thank you.
